div.bibl: YEAR BOOK OF ST. CONSTANTINE CHURCH AND KORAIS SCHOOL, 1936, p. 132. [In English] The Greek Woman's University Club

body.p: One of the most outstanding and post active organizations of Greek woman in the City of Chicago is the Greek Women's University Club, which was founded February 1931 at the suggestion of the late Reverend Constantione Harvalis. The chief purpose of this organization is the promotion of education among Greek girls and Greek women.

In fulfillment of this purpose the Club established a Scholarship Fund and during the past two years this fund had enabled the club to give financial assistance to four deserving Greek girls enrolled in Chicago high schools.

This year, the Greek Women's University Club has established a scholarship at the University of Chicago, go, which is known as "the Greek Women's University Club Scholarship". Miss Evengeline Joures, a graduate of Austin High School has been awarded the scholarship for the academic year of 1955-1936 and is now enrolled as a freshman of the University.

The scholarship is maintained by proceeds of benefit affairs which the
club sponsors. There affairs include annual scholarship fund dances, and musicales at which Greek talent is presented.

The club also sponsors lectures, and has in the past presented such notable persons as Mrs. Kenneth Brown (Demetra Vaka), Dr. George Vlastos of Ontario, Canada, and also our own Dr. Nicholas D. Cheronis, Mr. Kimon Priar, young Greek poet and dramatist and Miss Elkine Canalos violinist have been presented in concerts.

Charter members of the club are: Misses Katherine Miller, Olga Massias, Marjorie Earvalis, Georgia Perivolaris, Helen Demetry, Irene Harvalis and Mrs. John Diamant. Officers are: Miss Harvalis, president; Miss Booloolnas, vice pres.; Miss Gavares Corresponding Sec.; Mrs. Spannon, recording Secretary; Miss Aphrodite Flambouras, Treasurer; and Mrs. Soter, historian.

Members of the Greek Women's University Club are, Mrs. Askounis, Miss Hay Bollas, Mrs. John Diamant, Miss Irene Harvalis, Mrs. John Lambakis, Miss Anne Manos, Miss Olga Massias, Miss Marie Helen Metos, Miss Katherine Miller, Miss Ruth Miller, Miss Pauline Mitchell, Miss Bessie Nicopoulos, Miss Ismene Papageorge, Miss Georgia Pernokis, Miss Georgia Perivolaris, Miss Alexandra Petropoulos, Miss Basilica Petropoulos, Miss Pauline Spirrison, Miss Belle N. Stamos, and Miss Sophie J. Stamos.
